result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Filed by Atty Scholz
The original document was titled: Letter from Doctor
The original history event date is: 10-03-2022
**Reviewed by Judge Reilly - Approved, letter shall be sealed**
Letter from the defendant's doctor
Hearing on November 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:38 PM; Case called for Hearing. Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M Jay in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Steven G Lubahn in court.  Attorney Amy C Scholz in court for Steven G Lubahn.  Atty. Scholz provides an update; due to her client's significant health issues she is requesting another further proceedings date in about 60 days.  State has no objection.  Court will adjourn for further proceedings in about 60 days but will order defense file a status letter from the defendant's physician, under seal, regarding his current health condition in the next two weeks.
Hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
Hearing on September 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

9:59 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Steven G Lubahn in court.  Attorney Amy C Scholz in court for Steven G Lubahn. Atty. Scholz provides an update, she is still waiting on an offer from the State.  Atty. Scholz requests another further proceedings date in about 30-45 days.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Hearing on August 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter dated 6/15/22 received and filed.  **Reviewed by Judge Lau 6/20/22 - to be addressed at next hearing**
Hearing on July 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:07 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Steven G Lubahn in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.  Chelsea Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Scholz advises he has discovery but is waiting on an offer, so she is requesting another further proceedings date.  State advises there is an offer and will email it to defense today.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.  Hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
Hearing on May 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.addlTxt: 01:11 PM Defendant Steven G Lubahn appeared by Zoom with attorney Amy C Scholz who appeared by Zoom.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Charlie Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Once this case has been reassigned the parties will receive notice of the next date.

Arraignment on March 17, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

09:21 AM Defendant Steven G Lubahn in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.  Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waive reading of Amended Complaint and Information.  Arraignment scheduled for March 17, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Laboratory report filed by the State.

Per Court, status of counsel date removed from calendar for January 19, 2022 at 1:00 pm.  Court reached out to defense counsel who is willing to waive the time limits associated with the preliminary hearing.  Defendant currently out of custody and no victim notification needed in this matter.  Date set with defense and the State for preliminary hearing.

records.addlTxt:
Adjustment Number: 22A 001874,
Payable Number: 455953,
Receipt Number: 22R 002301,
Amount: $20.00
Hearing on January 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.  Defendant to report to WCS the first business day after their release from custody.  Defendant is to report and complay with the Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Intervention Program including sobriety testing in accordance with WCS program protoocols.

01:57 PM Defendant Steven G Lubahn in court, in custody, with attorney Kirk R. Emick as a friend of the court by zoom video.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.    Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for January 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
